course.title: The Early Modern Artist
course.description: Explores the emergence of artistic individuality in French 18th-century art and culture. What was modern about the 18th-century artist? What were the criteria of artistic self-definition? Among the issues addressed: the cultural myth of the artist; artist vs. critic; artistic identity and the philosophical notions of the self; subjectivity, sexuality, and gender; the artist's touch; authorship; melancholia; eccentricity; the artist's body; fashion. Artists include: Watteau, Chardin, Fragonard, Vigee-Lebrun, David, Girodet. Museum trip(s).
